Can we deduce the original function \\( z(t) \\) exactly after observing the Fourier transform \\( F(z)(\omega) \\) without knowing the specific form of \\( z(t) \\)?
Explanation: The Fourier transform of a purely exponential function like \\( z(t) = e^{i\omega t} \\) results in a distinct frequency spike (delta function) at \\( \omega \). Thus, observing the Fourier transform allows us to exactly deduce that the original function was indeed \\( e^{i\omega t} \), given the characteristic nature of this transformation.
